title: Magnus Pegel
summary: Magnus Pegel (or Pegelius or Pegelow) (15 May 1547 â€“ 1619) was a German doctor and mathematician.[1] Pegel was born in Rostock in Pomerania/Germany and was one of the first authors to write (in 1604) about the theory of blood transfusions.[2][3][4][5]  He died at Stettin.
